meanings.definition: To tell someone a secret or private matter.
meanings.sent1: She confided in her best friend about her crush.
meanings.sent2: He confided in his sister about his fears.
meanings.sent3: The cat confided in the dog about its hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: The old tree confided in the wind about its ancient wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The diary confided in its pages the deepest secrets of its owner.

meanings.definition: To entrust something to someone for safekeeping.
meanings.sent1: She confided her jewelry to her mother before going on vacation.
meanings.sent2: He confided the key to his friend while he was away.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel confided its acorns to the care of the wise owl.
meanings.sent4: The captain confided the treasure map to his loyal crew.
meanings.sent5: The museum confided the ancient artifact to the expert for restoration.
